metadata.title: CVE-2021-39711 on Ubuntu 24.10 (oracular) - medium
metadata.description:
In bpf_prog_test_run_skb of test_run.c, there is a possible out of boundsread due to Incorrect Size Value. This could lead to local informationdisclosure with System execution privileges needed. User interaction is notneeded for exploitation.Product: AndroidVersions: Android kernelAndroid ID:A-154175781References: Upstream kernel

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-39711` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.8.0-31-generic - 6.8.0-31.31
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-generic - 6.8.0-31.31
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-generic-64k - 6.8.0-31.31
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1008-aws - 6.8.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1007-azure - 6.8.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1007-gcp - 6.8.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1005-oracle - 6.8.0-1005.5
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1005-oracle-64k - 6.8.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-6.8.0-1004-raspi - 6.8.0-1004.4
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-lowlatency - 6.8.0-31.31.1
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-lowlatency-64k - 6.8.0-31.31.1
No subscription required
